response.overview: Journalists Ichiro Sakai and Junko cover the wreckage of a typhoon when an enormous egg is found and claimed by greedy entrepreneurs. Mothra's fairies arrive and are aided by the journalists in a plea for its return. As their requests are denied, Godzilla arises near Nagoya and the people of Infant Island must decide if they are willing to answer Japan's own pleas for help.
response.tagline: A massive Mach 3 moth! The heavy missile tank Godzilla! The sky, sea, and land quake in the fierce battle of the century!
response.title: Mothra vs. Godzilla

release_dates.note: Madman Entertainment DVD titled "Godzilla - Showa Classics Volume 1". Same as 2006 disc. Packaged with "Godzilla: Invasion of Astro-Monster", "Godzilla vs. Ebirah", "Son of Godzilla", "Godzilla: Destroy all Monsters", and "Godzilla: All Monsters Attack" (6 discs).
Madman Entertainment DVD titled "Godzilla vs. Mothra". Includes AIP cut cropped into 1.33:1 & JP cut with English subtitles (one disc).
Re-release. Exact date unknown.
Exact date unknown.
DVD
Gloria Film West German release titled "Godzilla and the Prehistoric Caterpillars".  Dubbing by SL Film Synchron GmbH, Berlin. Contains "Frontier Missile Assault" sequence from the US AIP version.
Anolis Entertainment DVD steelbook titled "Godzilla und die Urweltraupen". Contains both Japanese and W. German theatrical versions. German subtitles.
Anolis Entertainment Blu-ray titled "Godzilla und die Urweltraupen". JP audio w/DE subs and German theatrical dub.
Warner-Pathe release titled "Godzilla vs. The Thing". Exact date unknown.
The Criterion Collection/Sony Blu-ray set titled "Godzilla, the Showa-Era Films, 1954-1975". In Japanese with English subtitles.
Kosmo Film International release titled "Watang! In the Fabulous Empire of Monsters". Includes the "Frontier Missile Assault" sequence. Exact date unknown.
Toho Champion Festival, Winter 1970. Shortened 74-minute cut edited by  Ishirō Honda.
75-minute shortened re-release version.
TOHO Visual Entertainment 4K UHD + Standard Blu-ray. Includes Champion Festival cut and 8mm digest version of "Mothra" (1961) (one disc).
"DVD Toho" DVD. Includes 1980 reissue cut and 8mm digest version of "Mothra" (1961) (one disc). CD jewel case set.
"DVD Toho" DVD. Reissue of the 2003 disc, packaged in a standard DVD keep case.
TOHO Visual Entertainment DVD. Reissue of 2008 disc, same features.
TOHO Visual Entertainment Blu-ray. Includes 1980 reissue cut and 8mm digest version of "Mothra" (1961).
American International Pictures (AIP) release titled "Godzilla vs. The Thing". Shortened to 88-minutes, includes all-new "Frontier Missile Assault" sequence. Dubbed by Titra Sound Studios.

Simitar Entertainment DVD set titled "Godzilla: 5 Rampaging Movies". Packaged w/"Godzilla, King of the Monsters!", "Godzilla vs. Monster Zero", "Godzilla's Revenge", and "Terror of Mechagodzilla". 5 discs, same features as 1998 disc.
Simitar Entertainment DVD. EN audio, only includes the US version, uncropped in 2.35:1. Disc is 2-sided and includes a cropped 1.33:1 version on the opposite side.
Classic Media DVD. Reissue of the 2007 DVD, all features included.
Classic Media/Sony Music Entertainment/Sony Wonder DVD. Only includes the cropped 1.33:1 AIP cut.
The Criterion Collection Blu-ray set titled "Godzilla, the Showa-Era Films, 1954-1975". In Japanese with English subtitles.
Classic Media DVD. In Japanese w/EN subs. Packaged with AIP's "Godzilla vs. The Thing" (1964) (one disc). AIP version is cropped to 16:9.
